page.title: 20HERNE BAY THIRTY YEARS AGO
page.content: To gain some idea of changes in Herne Bay since the Coronation of 1953 children asked anyone in their family who remembered the town at this time for their impressions. The main one was that old Herne Bay had so much more life and vitality about it in the Summer. There used to be so many people along the sea front sitting in deckchairs, walking, drinking tea. For the swimmers there were a series of rafts anchored off-shore. Along the pier a small steam train pulled open carriages of passengers to meet the steamer. On the shore was the Punch and Judy man who also gave a magic show. From the beaches pleasure boats took people for an hours ride. There would be a Summer Show in the Pier Pavilion and music in the bandstand. The only note of caution was that we only remember the sunny days.
